intro: Knautia dipsacifolia subsp. catalaunica, commonly known as the Catalan knautia, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. It blooms in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
